conclusion: The process from state C to state D is shown in the p-V diagram as a horizontal line segment, representing an isobaric process at constant pressure.
The constant pressure during the process from C to D is $p_{CD} = 0.75 \times 10^5$ Pa.
The volume at state C is $V_C = 4$ L, and the volume at state D is $V_D = 3$ L.
Convert the volumes from liters to cubic meters: $V_C = 4 \times 10^{-3}$ m$^3$ and $V_D = 3 \times 10^{-3}$ m$^3$.
The work done by the gas during an isobaric process is given by $W = p \Delta V$.
Calculate the work done by the gas from state C to state D using $W_{CD} = p_{CD}(V_D - V_C)$.
Substitute the values: $W_{CD} = (0.75 \times 10^5 \text{ Pa}) \times (3 \times 10^{-3} \text{ m}^3 - 4 \times 10^{-3} \text{ m}^3)$.
The work done externally by the gas is negative because the volume decreases from C to D, indicating compression.
